thread.title: India's top engineering talent to showcase innovations at IIT-Hyderabad's IInvenTiv | Hyderabad News - Times of India
thread.title_full: India's top engineering talent to showcase innovations at IIT-Hyderabad's IInvenTiv | Hyderabad News - Times of India

author: Donita Jose
title: India's top engineering talent to showcase innovations at IIT-Hyderabad's IInvenTiv | Hyderabad News - Times of India
text: HYDERABAD: The second edition of IInvenTiv 2024 will be held in IIT-Hyderabad on January 19 and 20, wherein 120 shortlisted research and innovation projects would be displayed. These projects were developed not just by 23 IITs across India, but include innovations from NITs, IISERs, IIITs, IISc and top 50-NIRF ranked engineering institutions. 106586697\"IInvenTiv is going to be much more inclusive this time as it will showcase technologies, research and innovation from 30 more institutions in addition to 23 IITs. We are expecting over 3,000 persons from the industry to visit the campus and catch a glimpse of the various R&D innovations. We hope the work would serve as a source of inspiration for our researchers to work on,\" said professor BS Murty, director of IIT-Hyderabad.6 projects from TelanganaThe event will have five broad themes under which various innovations will be displayed. This includes 35 innovations in affordable healthcare, 31 in sustainable technologies, 21 in agriculture and food processing, 17 in defense and space, and 13 industry 4.0 innovations. From Telangana, IIIT-Hyderabad will display three research projects, IIT-Hyderabad will display two research projects and NIT-Warangal one project.120 researches shortlisted\"We received about 240 entries and 120 were shortlisted. This is 40 more than the previous edition and the entries have come from various institutes. The maximum number of innovation entries came in for sustainable technologies,\" added Professor Murty.BVR Mohan Reddy, chairman of IInvenTiv 2024 added, \"Platforms that link academia and industry are critical for the country as in future 25% GDP of our economy will be contributed by manufacturing.\"
